text: Location of Tokoro District in Okhotsk Subprefecture is a district located in Okhotsk Subprefecture, Hokkaido, Japan. As of 2005, the district has an estimated population of 16,291 and a population density of 15 persons per km². The total area is 1,123.42 km². ==Towns and villages== *Kunneppu *Oketo *Saroma ==History== *In 1869, when Hokkaido was divided into provinces and districts, Tokoro was placed in Kitami Province. *June 10, 1942 Notsukeushi Town becomes a City with the new name of Kitami, separating it from the district. *November 15, 1950 Part of Shimoyuubetsu Village incorporated into Saroma Village (now Town) *September 30, 1956 Aiuchi Village incorporated into Kitami, leaving the district. *On March 5, 2006 the towns of Rubeshibe, Tanno and Tokoro were merged into the city of Kitami. Category:Districts in Hokkaido
title: Tokoro District, Hokkaido
